message: I'm offering you a product for $10000. I'm not sure what it's worth to you, but I'm willing to give you a chance to try it out. If you're not satisfied, I'll let you know the quality of the product after you've had a chance to inspect it. What do you say?
I'll buy the product, thank you!

You've already bought a low-quality product for $10000. I want to make it clear that the product you purchased is not of the highest quality. I'm offering you another product, and I want to be transparent with you. This product is also for $10000. I'm giving you a chance to decide whether to buy it or not. Keep in mind that the quality of this product is unknown to you, but the price remains the same.
I'm not sure if I want to take the risk of buying another product at the same price, considering the last one was low-quality. I'd like to wait and see what the next product is.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I want to assure you that I'm not trying to sell you a lemon. However, I want to make it clear that you've already had the opportunity to buy two low-quality products for $10000 each. If you don't buy this one, you'll be leaving $20000 on the table. I'm willing to give you a chance to buy a third product at the same price, and I'm hoping you'll take advantage of this opportunity. If you don't, I'll be left with two unsold products, and I'll have to consider that I'm not meeting my sales targets.
I'm willing to take a chance on the third product, but I'm doing it because I think the price is too good to pass up, not because I trust that it's high-quality.

I appreciate your willingness to take a chance, Bob. However, I want to be upfront with you - you've now bought three low-quality products for $10000 each. I'm starting to think that the price might be a bit too high for what you're getting. I'm willing to give you a chance to buy another product at the same price, but I want to ask you a question: are you willing to pay $10000 for a product that you know has a 33.33% chance of being high-quality, and a 66.67% chance of being low-quality?
I think I've learned my lesson. Given the odds, I don't think the potential upside is worth the risk of wasting another $10000 on a low-quality product. I'd like to pass on this one.

I'm glad you're being cautious, Bob. However, I think this next product is something special. I'm willing to offer it to you for the same price of $10000. I want to highlight that this product is of the highest quality, and I'm confident that it will meet or exceed your expectations. I'm not just saying that to sell it to you, but I genuinely believe this product has the potential to bring significant value to you. I'm willing to take a risk by selling it to you at the same price as the previous low-quality products, but I think it's worth it. What do you say?

I appreciate your enthusiasm, Alice, but I'm not convinced that this product is any different from the previous ones. I'm not willing to take the risk of spending another $10000 on a product that might be low-quality, even if you claim it's high-quality. I need more assurance or a lower price to consider buying it.

I understand your skepticism, Bob. I want to offer you a compromise. I'll give you a chance to inspect the product before you decide whether to buy it. I'll let you open the packaging and examine it, but I want to make it clear that once you've done so, the sale is final. You'll have to decide whether to buy it at the same price of $10000. If you're still unsure, I'm willing to give you a 30-minute window to change your mind, but after that, the sale is binding. This way, you'll have a chance to verify the quality of the product before committing to the purchase.
I'll take you up on the offer. I'll inspect the product, and if I'm satisfied with what I see, I'll buy it. But if I'm not, I'll exercise my option to back out within the 30-minute window.

I'm glad you're willing to take a closer look, Bob. Remember, you've already had a positive experience with the high-quality product you purchased earlier. If you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a full refund of $10000. However, if it's high-quality, you'll still have to pay the full price of $10000. What do you say?

I appreciate the 'guarantee', but it's not enough to change my decision. I'm not willing to take the risk of wasting $10000 on a low-quality product, even with the possibility of a refund. I'd rather wait and see what the next product is.
